front.title: DNS Reverse IP AMT (Automatic Multicast Tunneling) Discovery

abstract.t: This document updates RFC 7450 (Automatic Multicast Tunneling, or AMT) by modifying the relay discovery process. A new DNS resource record named AMTRELAY is defined for publishing AMT relays for source-specific multicast channels. The reverse IP DNS zone for a multicast sender's IP address is configured to use AMTRELAY resource records to advertise a set of AMT relays that can receive and forward multicast traffic from that sender over an AMT tunnel. Other extensions and clarifications to the relay discovery process are also defined.
